cellularAutomata.graphics
Class AllPanelController

java.lang.Object
  cellularAutomata.graphics.AllPanelController

public class AllPanelController
extends java.lang.Object

Controls interactions between components on the panels. The Panels hold the components (StartPanel, Status Panel, etcetera), the AllPanelListener hears events, and the listener calls methods in this class. This class calls the individual panels to change their appearance. Essentially a Mediator design pattern.

Author:
David Bahr

addTab

public void addTab(Analysis analysis,
                   javax.swing.JPanel panel,
                   java.lang.String title,
                   java.lang.String toolTipDescription)
Adds the JPanel as a tab.

Parameters:
analysis - The analysis being displayed on the tabbed pane.
panel - The panel added to the tabbed pane.
title - The title of the tab.
toolTipDescription - The tool tip for the tab (may be null).

chooseRandomRuleNumber

public void chooseRandomRuleNumber()
Selects a random rule number for the rule number text field.

disableNumStatesField

public void disableNumStatesField(boolean updateProperties)
Disables the number of states field as necessary, depending on whether certain rules are selected or not.

Parameters:
updateProperties - If true the method will update the NUMBER_OF_STATES in the CA properties and display the result on the status panel. (Will probably only be true when called from the constructor of this class. At other times, we'll usually want to make sure that the submit button has been pressed before making these changes. This method is called whenever the user selects a new rule, even if they have not submitted the rule.)

disableRadiusField

public void disableRadiusField()
Disables the radius field if the Moore lattice is not selected.

disableRuleNumberField

public void disableRuleNumberField(boolean updateProperties)
Disables the rule number field as necessary, depending on whether the ruleNumber class is selected or not.

Parameters:
updateProperties - If true the method will update the RULE_NUMBER in the CA properties and display the result on the status panel. (Will probably only be true when called from the constructor of this class or RulePanel's reset(). At other times, we'll usually want to make sure that the submit button has been pressed before making these changes. This method is called whenever the user selects a new rule, even if they have not submitted the rule.)

Disables the number of states field as necessary, depending on whether certain rules are selected or not.

Parameters:
updateProperties - If true the method will update the NUMBER_OF_STATES in the CA properties and display the result on the status panel. (Will probably only be true when called from the constructor of this class. At other times, we'll usually want to make sure that the submit button has been pressed before making these changes. This method is called whenever the user selects a new rule, even if they have not submitted the rule.)

                                     java.lang.String currentRule)
Resets the initial state chooser so that it includes any initial state options specified by the rule.

Parameters:
currentInitialState - The currently selected initial state. May be null if it is unknown.

checkProperties

public java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> checkProperties()
Check that the user submitted properties have reasonable values.

Returns:
Either a table of the properties (keyed by string names that are available in the CurrentProperties class), or null if the user submitted values are not ok.

submitProperties

public void submitProperties(java.util.Hashtable<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> userSubmittedProperties)
Set the user submitted properties. Recommended that the properties first be checked with the method checkProperties().

Parameters:
userSubmittedProperties - A hash table of the properties that will be set.
